Legal moves from my head (8,6):

- UP -> (8,7) is my neck (occupied). Illegal.
- LEFT -> (7,6) is my body. Illegal.
- RIGHT -> (9,6) is free.
- DOWN -> (8,5) is free.

So the only reasonable options are RIGHT (to (9,6)) or DOWN (to (8,5)).

Comparison:
- DOWN moves me closer to a tight cluster of apples in column 8 (notably (8,3) and (8,2) and then (8,0)) — shortest path to a nearby apple.
- From (8,5) I will still have at least two follow-up moves (DOWN to continue toward apples, RIGHT to (9,5) if needed). LEFT is blocked by my body and UP would be backward.
- RIGHT to (9,6) is also safe this turn, but it pushes me against the right board edge (x=9) which reduces future maneuvering options. The nearest apples on the right are farther away than the ones straight down.
- No enemy head is close enough for an immediate head-on risk.

Short plan: move down into column 8 and collect the nearby apples at (8,3)/(8,2)/(8,0). While doing so, avoid getting boxed against the right edge — prefer to keep at least one open column to my left for escape. Re-evaluate if an opponent approaches.
